clues.text: Battles between these fighters in the Roman Colosseum were stopped in 404 A.D.

In construction, it's a horizontal load-bearing structural member
This volcano on the side of Hawaii's Mauna Loa once contained a lake of bubbling molten lava
This Argentinian peak near the Chilean border is only 623 feet higher than nearby 22,211-foot Cerro Mercedario
This Alpine peak rises 14,692 feet on the border of Switzerland's Valais Canton & Italy's Piedmont region
In 1896 an Alaskan mount was named for this man elected president that year
According to the Bible, Moses saw the Promised Land from this mountain in Jordan's Pisgah Range

To deduct these, your new job must be over 50 miles farther from your former home than your old job was
If you've been selected for one of these, the IRS cheerfully informs you that many of them result in refunds
Filing jointly, families with 2 or more kids & making under $34,178 a year may receive the EITC, this credit

Air Force general & George Wallace running mate celebrated by pole dancers in the spring

In December 1946 he attacked the French at Tonkin, beginning a war that ended 8 years later
In 1739 the Peacock Throne, built for Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan, was stolen by these people

Of 14, 18 or 24 hours, the scheduled length of the world's longest nonstop flight, from Singapore to NYC
Flying at the then-incredible speed of 575 mph, the Boeing 707 began commercial flight service in this decade
A subsidiary of AMR Corporation, this airline is the world's largest, with more than 1,000 planes & 4,000 flights daily

This newspaper, the CSM, was established in 1908
The "S" in UNESCO is for "scientific"; this is what the "E" is for & remember, it's an adjective, not a noun

rounds.category: YOU'RE GOING TO WIN A PULITZER!

clues.text: Julia Keller won in 2005 for her reporting on a 10-second event: the destruction of Utica, Illinois by this
In 2007 "Counter Intelligence" columnist Jonathan Gold became the first critic of these to win a Pulitzer
This paper won in 1993 for public service for coverage of Hurricane Andrew & its aftermath
The first 2 Pulitzers for writing these, to the N.Y. Tribune & Louisville Courier Journal, didn't name the authors
Russell Jones won for his reporting about Soviet repression from this capital in 1956
Rejected by USC Film School, this "S" in DreamWorks SKG now sits on the Film School's Board of Councilors
"Jerry Maguire" was originally written for Tom... not Cruise, but him
